p: 2. Guided by the issues themselves. By “ontology” we do not mean a specific philosophical discipline that can be lined up with other disciples like epistemology, ethics, and so forth. This book is not trying to meet the established standards of any discipline of philosophy. The only standard we follow is to remain focused on our first-person experience of the “things themselves,” ◊ which is an axiom that applies to all sciences and disciplines.
